results.title: Indochine [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Paradis Films, La Generale D'Images, Bac Films (France), Orly Films, Cine 5, Eric Heumann, Jean Labadie and Regis Wargnier
results.brief_description: Set in 1930 in French Indochina, on the cusp of revolution, the 1993 Academy Award Winning Best Foreign Film, “Indochine” is the epic story of two women; a French mother and her adopted Indochinese daughter. Their relationship survives social and cultural obstacles, but is ultimately stretched to extremes by their passionate love for the same man. The awesome beauty of Vietnam provides a perfect backdrop for this splendid film. Catherine Deneuve gives a “tour de force” performance. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Indiscretion of an American wife = Stazione Termini
results.creator_credit: Selznick Releasing Organization and Vittorio De Sica
results.brief_description: Mary is an American housewife trying to make the heart-rending decision of whether to go back to her husband and family or remain in Rome with her lover, Giovanni, a university professor she has met during her stay. Most of the story takes place in the Rome railway station, where Mary and Giovanni meet for one last desperate rendezvous. Their search for a secluded spot where they can be together, threatens to expose their illicit affair. However, an understanding railroad commissioner releases the two and Mary is permitted to return to her husband with an unsullied reputation. Cast includes: Jennifer Jones, Montgomery Clift, Gino Cervi and Richard Beymer.

results.title: Indiscreet
results.brief_description: A NATO officer meets a beautiful actress and falls in love with her, but protects himself by saying he is married. The script of this film was written by Norman Krasna, based on his play “Kind Sir”. It stars Cary Grant and Ingrid Bergman.

results.title: In which we serve
results.creator_credit: Two Cities Films, Noel Coward and David Lean
results.brief_description: In which we serve is a story of a British destroyer, the H.M.S. Torrin, from its completion to its destruction at sea by the Germans. She is divebombed in the Battle of Crete, but the survivors carry on the fight. Through their experiences are shown the ordeals, the achievements and the gallantry of H.M.S. Torrin. Stars Noel Coward, John Mills, Bernard Miles, Celia Johnson, Michael Wilding and Richard Attenborough.

results.title: In the wake of the Bounty
results.brief_description: Chauvel’s first “talkie”, this film merges documentary footage and dramatic historical reconstruction. Re-enacts the mutiny led by Fletcher Christian (Errol Flynn) in 1789 against the master of the Bounty, William Bligh (Mayne Lynton), and depicts the fate of the mutineers on Tahiti and remote Pitcairn Island. Provides a unique and spectacular record of the life of the isolated community of Pitcairn in 1932 with most of the inhabitants being descendants of the Bounty mutineers. This was the first film shot on Pitcairn Island and the first in which the Australian actor, Errol Flynn, appeared. The dramatised footage was shot at the Cinesound Studio in Sydney. Cast also includes Victor Gouriet and John Warwick

results.title: In the name of the father [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Hell's Kitchen, Gabriel Byrne and Jim Sheridan
results.brief_description: Gerry Conlon, a petty crook in Belfast during the 1970’s, gets in trouble with the IRA. His father sends him to England where a twist of fate puts him in the wrong place at the wrong time when a pub in Guildford is bombed. Gerry and three of his friends, although innocent, are charged and convicted. Gerry’s father joins him in prison and despite years of a strained relationship, Gerry learns to regard his father’s gentle spirit as a strength. Enlisting the aid of a lawyer, Guiseppe Conlon is determined to prove his son’s innocence, and when he dies in prison, Gerry is determined to take up the cause. Evidence is discovered which implicates senior police officials in a massive cover-up, and the ‘Guildford Four’ are finally set free. Daniel Day-Lewis, Pete Postlethwaite and Emma Thompson are brilliant in their roles.

results.title: In the line of fire
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Jeff Apple and Wolfgang Petersen
results.brief_description: Secret Service Agent, Frank Horrigan (Clint Eastwood) is forced into a test of wills by master assassin (John Malkovich) in a fight to save the president. It is an all too familiar situation for Horrigan who was present when Kennedy was shot and is haunted by the possibility that he could have saved his life. Assigned to protect the current president, the assassin tests Horrigan to see whether given the second chance he will risk his life to save the president. Also starring Rene Russo, Dylan McDermott, Fred Dalton Thompson and John Mahoney.

results.title: In the King of Prussia
results.creator_credit: Turin Film Corporation and Emile de Antonio
results.brief_description: In September 1980, eight Catholic pacifists known as the Plowshare 8 entered the G. E. plant known as ‘King of Prussia’. They damaged two nuclear missile nose-cones and poured blood on weapon parts. By condensing 1300 pages of trial transcripts into a 70-page film script a courtroom drama has been staged. The defendants play themselves. Cast: The Plowshares 8, Martin Sheen, Jackson Browne.

results.title: In the heat of the night
results.creator_credit: Mirisch Corporation, Walter Mirisch and Norman Jewison
results.brief_description: Set in the deep South at the height of the early 60’s racial tension, this superbly crafted murder mystery deserved all five of its Academy Awards. Best actor winner Rod Steiger gives a definitive performance as a small town, red-neck sheriff who finds himself in an uneasy alliance with a black homicide detective from Philadelphia, strikingly portrayed by Sidney Poitier. In the course of investigating the crime, the two strong-willed men must reconcile their inherent prejudice towards each other. The final result is justice and an unlikely but touching mutual respect. Supporting performances by Warren Oates and Lee Grant, an evocative score by Quincy Jones and Haskell Wexler’s vivid cinematography combine to create the stifling aura of a hot summer evening in the South. The Oscar winning script by Stirling Silliphant is based on a novel by John Ball.

results.title: In search of Anna
results.creator_credit: Storm Productions, Australian Film Commission, Victorian Film Corporation and Esben Storm
results.brief_description: Tony has just been released from Pentridge after serving six years for robbery. He sets out to settle old scores and search for his girlfriend Anna. In the process he hitches a ride north with the enigmatic Sam and a relationship develops between them. The theme of coming to terms with the past is expressed formally through the non-chronological structure which produces a split narrative - the Melbourne scenes and the journey north - which inform each other as the story unfolds. Underlying the journey to awareness is the city/country antinomy - the country has the power to liberate what the city has entrapped. Features the music of AC/DC, Rose Tattoo, Stiletto, The Angels and Steve Wright. Cast includes Richard Moir, Judy Morris, Chris Haywood, Bill Hunter, Ian Nimmo, Maurie Fields.
